arm_group.description: Wash in of desflurane in an anaesthesia machine without below
Wash in of desflurane in conventional anaesthesia machine Asys

brief_summary.textblock:
To study the Flow-I breathing circle during low flow general anaesthesia, whether this
      non-below system has advantages reduced time to reach Et 1MAC (minimal alveolar
      concentration) and lower consumption of inhaled agent

detailed_description.textblock:
Assessing whether there are clinical differences in anaesthetic performance between standard
      anaesthesia workstation including a below and the new Flow-I device without a below

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

        ASA 1-2 patient 18 - 65 years scheduled for elective surgery

        Exclusion Criteria:

        ASA > 2 heart failure COPD

clinical_study.official_title: Low Flow Anaesthesia; Cost-effectiveness of the Flow-I Anaesthesia Machine, a Comparison to Established Anaesthesia Delivery Unit

other_outcome.description: Patients will be asked after end of anaesthesia if they have had any recall of intraoperative events

primary_outcome.description: The time needed, seconds, to increase the end tidal desflurane concentration during wash-in from a 1 MAC to a 1.5 MAC with a constant fresh gas flow of 1 L/min and the vaporiser set a 3 MAC ( minimal alveolar concentration) (18%) will be compared between the two study groups
primary_outcome.measure: Time to reach 1.5 MAC (minimal alveolar concentration) Et

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

secondary_outcome.description: The vaporiser will be weighed before and after each case and the amount of vapor, desflurane, consumed during the anaesthesia will be calculated Gr/min.
secondary_outcome.measure: amount of inhaled agent consumed ml/min

secondary_outcome.description: Quality of recovery will be followed during the first 72 hours after anaesthesia

clinical_study.study_design: Allocation: Randomized, Endpoint Classification: Pharmacokinetics/Dynamics Study, Intervention Model: Single Group Assignment, Masking: Single Blind (Subject)
